abstract: When you shop at a big-box retailer are you fraternizing with the enemy? Or are you just trying to save money and stay in business?
snippet: When you shop at a big-box retailer are you fraternizing with the enemy? Or are you just trying to save money and stay in business?
lead_paragraph: I remember the first time my husband and I visited the Wal-Mart Supercenter in Bentonville, Ark. It was July, 2003, just a few weeks after we had moved to Northwest Arkansas from Seattle, and it was the first time I had ever shopped at a Wal-Mart. As we turned the car off of Walton Boulevard — directly across from Wal-Mart’s corporate headquarters — it felt as if our Volkswagen Passat was being swallowed into the vast parking lot of pick-ups and S.U.V.’s the way the tiny rebel spaceship was sucked into Darth Vader’s star destroyer.

abstract: After the Supreme Court threw out a sex-discrimination case against Wal-Mart, the plaintiffs are trying again by narrowing the class to women in California only.
snippet: After the Supreme Court threw out a sex-discrimination case against Wal-Mart, the plaintiffs are trying again by narrowing the class to women in California only.
lead_paragraph: Four months after the Supreme Court tossed out their national class-action lawsuit, lawyers representing women who claimed that Wal-Mart Stores had discriminated against them filed a new lawsuit on Thursday that narrowed their claims to the California stores of the retail chain.

headline.main: Female Wal-Mart Employees File New Bias Case
headline.print_headline: Female Wal-Mart Employees File a New Bias Case
